instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: MacBook Battery Repair
threads.message:
Anyone have any experience repairing these newer (2013+) batteries?or any other similar?
I’ve been messing around some and focusing on the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damaged/ swollen batteries as the boards are easily accessed. 
Cant find much in the way of information through searching -most results are replacement guides or services offered. Found a general li-ion protection board diagram but not specific enough to help. 
Would like to figure out how to reverse the triggers that send a signal to ‘replace now’ or detect gas. (Not disable for obvious safety reasons). 

Have a a lot of these building up. Would rather rebuild than create a ridiculous power bank.

threads.title: MacBook Battery Repair
threads.message:
If you have time (more than money) to spend, search Internet
[url]http://be2works.com/[/url]
[url]http://ubrt.com.ua/[/url]

threads.title: MacBook Battery Repair
threads.message: Need UBRT cause the other one cannot unseal the newer BQ chipset. All 100% hopeless, don't waste time.

threads.title: MacBook Battery Repair
threads.message: Guess I’ll just start making a home powerbank then.. think I just need about 100 a1502s for that!
